_header: The nightingale singeth / That all the wood ringeth
_description: Love lyric expressing love-longing — six short lines, aabccb

OxfLinLat129.Transcription:
The nythynggale synggyththat al the whode rynggythAnd the popyn
                    iayBut heo be my boteDeyn y motelong or eny day
OxfLinLat129.Note:
Written on 2½ lines, as prose amid a list of Latin sentences, some
                    with English glosses; this one translating Latin ‘Lustrans in vastis
                        siluis psalit philomena…’, which follows it; variant version
                    from that in Aberystwyth,  National Library of Wales Peniarth 356 (5420).
